trail.name: 86 Rosemount Place
trail.description: The Macleod family home from 1883, when JJR was aged 7, till 1895.

trail.name: 15 Kings Gate
trail.description: The Macleod family home from 1895, when JJR was aged 19

trail.name: Aberdeen Grammer School
trail.description: JJR attended Aberdeen Grammar School from 1884 to 1893.

trail.name: John Knox Free Church in Gerrard Street
trail.description: JJR's father, The Rev Macleod, was minister here from 1895 to 1915.

trail.name: Craigievar, his home from 1930 in Cults
trail.description: JJR supervised the building of a new house called Craigievar at the western extremity of Cults where he and his wife moved on its completion in 1930.

trail.name: The JJR Macleod Centre for Diabetes, Endocrinology and Metabolism (MacDEM)
trail.description: Opened by Professor Bliss in November 2013

trail.name: JJR Macleod's grave
trail.description: Macleod was buried in Allenvale Cemetery overlooking the River Dee

trail.name: The former Aberdeen Medico-Chirurgical Society
trail.description: Macleod was a member of the Aberdeen Medico-Chirurgical Society, housed, at the time in the building at 29 King Street, which was completed in 1820 to the plans of Archibald Simpson

trail.name: Marischal College
trail.description: Macleod did his academic medical studies, from 1893 to 1898 at Marischal College

trail.name: Children’s Hospital in Castle Terrace
trail.description: The Children’s Hospital was in Castle Terrace, opened in 1877

trail.name: Woolmanhill Hospital
trail.description: When Macleod was a student the main Infirmary, with medical and surgical facilities, was at Woolmanhill
